subject: Learning
title: AI Tutors: The Next Frontier
description: A quick, practical guide to AI Tutors: The Next Frontier.

hook.text: In 1984, Benjamin Bloom showed that one-on-one tutoring improved performance by two standard deviations.

buildup.text: The challenge: there aren't enough tutors for every student. It's called Bloom's 2-sigma problem.

discovery.text: AI tutoring systems attempt to solve this by providing personalized, adaptive instruction at scale.

twist.text: Current AI tutors handle content delivery well but still struggle with motivation and emotional support.

climax.text: The technology improves monthly. The question is no longer if AI will tutor, but how well.

punchline.text: Every student deserves a tutor. AI might finally make that possible.

quiz.question: What is Bloom's 2-sigma problem?
options: One-on-one tutoring is vastly superior but there aren't enough tutors for everyone
Students learn twice as fast in groups than alone
AI already outperforms human tutors completely
